snippet: Six tons of illegal elephant ivory that the government has been stockpiling for three decades will be crushed and used in antipoaching memorials, officials announced.
abstract: United States Fish and Wildlife Service plans to destroy six tons of illegal African elephant ivory it has been stockpiling since 1980s; officials point to increased demand that is leading to devastating rise in poaching; hopes destruction of ivory will send message of zero tolerance and reduce appeal of ivory, rhinoceros horns and other illicit animal products.
lead_paragraph: Six tons of illegal elephant ivory that the government has been stockpiling for three decades will be crushed and used in antipoaching memorials, officials announced.

headline.main: In a Message to Poachers, U.S. Will Destroy Its Ivory
headline.print_headline: In a Message to Poachers, U.S. to Destroy Its Ivory
